website_summaries.verdict: From its chic dark-blue design to its comfortable tilted keyboard and crisp 4K display, the Asus ZenBook S represents a good deal on a good-looking ultrabook.
cons: HDMI and USB Type-A require use of (bundled) dongles

customer_reviews.title: This computer has better specs than any other computer in its category
customer_reviews.text: This computer has better specs than any other computer in its category. It is slightly more expensive, but its lighter at ~2lbs and has a better quality screen. The computer has a very high screen to body ratio.
customer_reviews.author: S Stallings

customer_reviews.title: Finger print magnet
customer_reviews.text: Pros: super fast load time, finger print sensor is also fast.light weight, slim, modern, keyboard is clicky, very fast charging time Cons: major finger print magnet on all surfaces of the laptop. Mousepad is a grippy, needs different dongles to accommodate interactions between laptop and other Electronics. Heat dissipation is low when computer is running at moderate power
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Trinh

customer_reviews.title: Works well, light, bad surface
customer_reviews.text: This laptop works well and is very lightweight/portable/silent. However, the screen is small since the keyboard is lifted. Also the major glaring flaw is that the surface of the laptop is made terribly. It gets horrible smudges and marks all over which are still there after washing. It comes in a fancy box like it's a luxury item, yet the outside surface is cheap. It constantly looks dirty. If your only concerned about function, it functions well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars. Generally Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this laptop even though I did return it. The 4k UHD screen is definitely incredible. And it is probably the slimmest and lightest model I have ever had these years. The hinge design is not only unique but practical as well. Keyboard and touch panel feel good but nothing fancy. Despite and pros, the battery life is a serious problem. You can imagine how fast one charge will wear out with a 4k design and an i7 processor. It does get better after I switch into 1080p resolution tho. But the display quality also got sacrificed. The only reason why I returned it is that I found a better price elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Yifan Xu

customer_reviews.title: everything is bad
customer_reviews.text: battery life is really bad, windows 10 its completely unpredictable, one minute says 7 hours the next it says 2, i don't know what the heck is going on but the touchscreen is so sensitive that it thinks im touching it and wont let me use the track pad. plenty of times I've heard static coming from the speakers. i don't know if I got a dud or what but I"m returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as you would expect, but not a bad computer
customer_reviews.text: The good: It is lightweight, has a premium feel, the touchscreen is pretty responsive, especially with the Asus pen. It lasts a long time on battery life. The bad: Do you want crisp blacks? You will not get them. Want the screen to be brighter? Not happening. Don't want to use the quiet fan because you are going to use some extra processing power and want to keep it cooler? Don't bother, it will shut the computer down by overheating it. Overall, it isn't worth the price. It is a nice computer, but I should have went with Razer again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas McClure

customer_reviews.title: Blue Screen Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend. Bought 2 units, replace each one once, 3 out of 4 were defect giving frequent blue screen errors. Resetting and formatting does not fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, performing laptop that will turn heads
customer_reviews.text: So far it's a great laptop. Light, the 4k is crisp, responsive. The only downside is that it only has the USB type C ports, it comes with standard USB and HDMI connectors, but if you need to use an SD card you need a separate connector. It smudges easily, so something to be aware of (see picture). Overall, it's a worthwhile investment and strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J.V.

customer_reviews.title: SUPER FAST
customer_reviews.text: I run commands in Python for genomics and bioinformatics database in Wheat ( 14 GB database). This laptop runs so smoothly. Highly recommended. It is not only pretty but also small and very light. It is a powerful, pretty light laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Luis A. Rivera Burgos

customer_reviews.title: Zenbook S is a good looking ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: Super-slim design with keyboard-tilt hinge. Sunny 4K touch screen. Two Thunderbolt 3 ports plus USB-C;From its chic dark-blue design to its comfortable tilted keyboard and crisp 4K display, the Asus ZenBook S represents a good deal on a good-looking ultrabook that rivals Dells XPS 13.
customer_reviews.author: Piyawan S.

customer_reviews.title: Folder weight
customer_reviews.text: So far it's working good. I used to have a 15” one and now using this laptop which is really light too is strange for me in a good way. I’m going to update in a long run how does it work.
customer_reviews.author: Elmira

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy- garbage
customer_reviews.text: I have owned six laptops from ASUS over the years. This will be my last. Poor battery life even in conservative battery use mode, device regularly locks user out, will not boot. Writing review on my phone as the keyboard has failed. Look elsewhere! Only three weeks old!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy H.

customer_reviews.title: Oh Asus, so close but another fail
customer_reviews.text: This zenbook is almost perfect (I picked up mine at micro center) Pros: -beautiful looking screen -touch screen -very light 2.3 pounds or so Cons: -runs extremely hot with no cooling. Some bozo at asus decided on this new monitor stand design that blocks the exhaust ports. Guess where the heat comes out on this thing (hint: it doesnt). This thing has 1 small fan and no where to dissipate heat. temperatures of 60-70C are normal for basic applications and if you happen to get a windows update or something that uses >20% cpu it will be an inferno on your lap/bed/wherever you use this thing. Come on asus-
customer_reviews.author: Paul D

customer_reviews.title: Battery :-(
customer_reviews.text: This ZenBook is a great design. I love the compact size, the design, color, the 4K resolution, ease of use, Biometric reader and speed of the processor. However, the product is marketed to have 10 hours of battery life and I was getting 5 hours for just web surfing and minimal photo editing. That was a deal breaker for me, so I returned the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: I really like it with one complaint
customer_reviews.text: Its a great little laptop and I honestly really like it a lot, but really only have one complaint and that is that the Linux driver support is a bit lacking. I've had issues with the sound card not working and with the touch pad being disabled unless the laptop is put to sleep and woke up (which you can still do using the touch screen). The touch pad issue seems to be resolved, but might not have noticed it since I bought a bluetooth mouse so i could more easily not deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas R Tieman

customer_reviews.title: Fine and nice, but has weaknesses
customer_reviews.text: Arrives with Win10pro, which has a lot of bloat, and takes forever -- but this is not a review of the OS. To boot linux, etc, you'd need to remove bitlocker. The device itself is nice. Good battery, weak speakers. Curiously tends to really show fingerprints, so it looks kind of dirty quick. Touchpad is easily touched while typing, which is a gripe. Comes with a charger, USBc-to-A, and usb-c-to-hdmi. All packed nice and elegant. Approx 2 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mido

product_meta.title: Asus ZenBook S UX391UA-XB74T Ultra-Thin and Light 13.3-Inch UHD 4K Touch Laptop, Intel Core i7-8550U, 16GB 2133MHz RAM, 512GB PCIe G3x4 SSD, Windows 10 Pro, FP Sensor, Thunderbolt
product_meta.description: Slim. Stunning. Supreme. Zenbook s UX391 is all these, yet so much more. Its elegant sophistication will touch your heart and enhance your Prestige, wherever you use it. Its effortless portability, powerful performance with Intel i7 Processor and no-compromise connectivity with Thunderbolt 3-enabled USB 3.1 Type C let you get things done without fuss, without drama. And its stunningly innovative design — incorporating our unique ErgoLift hinge that improves both cooling and typing experience. *The actual transfer speed of USB 3.0, 3.1 (Gen 1 and 2), and/or Type-C will vary depending on many factors including the processing speed of the host device, file attributes and other factors related to system configuration and your operating environment.
feature_bullets: Crafted from premium aerospace-grade aluminum to create a anybody all metal finish that is less than 0.5 inch thin, weighs only 2.2 lbs
Latest Intel 8th Gen Core i7-8550U Processor 8M Cache, up to 4.00 GHz, Cooled by copper-alloy heat pipe and liquid-crystal-polymer fan
13.3” UHD 4K touch Display that supports stylus, 350nits brightness with 178° viewing angles and 85% Screen to body ratio NanoEdge bezel
16GB LPDDR3 2133MHz RAM, 512GB SSD, 802.11AC Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1, latest Thunderbolt 3-enabled USB 3.1 Type C (*usb transfer speed may vary. Learn more at Asus website)
Exclusive ErgoLift hinge automatically tilts The keyboard to the most comfortable typing position. Backlit keyboard

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars35 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
